title: Video: Father Sculptor – Lowlands
content:
Scantily clad women pouring milk and froot loops all over their writhing bodies? This is like my seventeenth birthday party all over again.

Manchester’s hottest new export, Father Sculptor have unveiled (via DIY) these slightly unsettling visuals to accompany forthcoming single Lowlands, featuring a couple of rather attractive young women. Iconic and heavily sexualised, it almost works as a direct contradiction to the grandiose sound of Father Sculptor, with the chorus of ‘long forgotten memories, of this city, still inside me / wanting to believe that I am free, that I can leave‘ providing the starkest contrast to the cereal induced self-mutilation.

Lowlands is taken from the Faith & Violence EP, out 15 April. Keep your eyes peeled for a UK tour.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
